Class ec.util.assertion.Assertion 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.util.assertion.Assertion
public class Assertion
extends Object
This class provides assertions you can add to your program. If the assertions fail, unchecked exceptions of class AssertionFailed are thrown.

Note: an assertion that is true (does not throw) nevertheless incurs the overhead of the method invocation. Assertions can be removed from the class file by a transforming class loader or a program that rewrites the class file, as described in Ways to Strip Assertions. That page also describes some 'gotchas' to beware when using assertions.

See Also:
AssertionFailed

Assertion()

fail()
If this method is executed, it throws an AssertionFailed with the message "Internal program error: 'Unreachable' code was reached." Plant such assertions in places the program should never reach (such as the default case in a switch).
fail(String)
If this method is executed, it throws an AssertionFailed with the given explanation, prefixed by "Internal program error: ".
test(boolean)
If the argument is false, throws an AssertionFailed with the message "Internal program error: Assertion failed."
test(boolean, Object, Object)
If the argument is false, throws an AssertionFailed with the given explanation arguments, concatenated as strings and prefixed by "Internal program error: ".
test(boolean, Object, Object, Object)
If the argument is false, throws an AssertionFailed with the given explanation arguments, concatenated as strings and prefixed by "Internal program error: ".
test(boolean, Object, Object, Object, Object)
If the argument is false, throws an AssertionFailed with the given explanation arguments, concatenated as strings and prefixed by "Internal program error: ".
test(boolean, Object, Object, Object, Object, Object)
If the argument is false, throws an AssertionFailed with the given explanation arguments, concatenated as strings and prefixed by "Internal program error: ".
test(boolean, Object, Object, Object, Object, Object, Object)
If the argument is false, throws an AssertionFailed with the given explanation arguments, concatenated as strings and prefixed by "Internal program error: ".
test(boolean, Object, Object, Object, Object, Object, Object, Object)
If the argument is false, throws an AssertionFailed with the given explanation arguments, concatenated as strings and prefixed by "Internal program error: ".
test(boolean, Object, Object, Object, Object, Object, Object, Object, Object)
If the argument is false, throws an AssertionFailed with the given explanation arguments, concatenated as strings and prefixed by "Internal program error: ".
test(boolean, String)
If the argument is false, throws an AssertionFailed with the given explanation, prefixed by "Internal program error: ".

Assertion 
 public Assertion()

test 
 public static void test(boolean mustBeTrue) throws AssertionFailed
If the argument is false, throws an AssertionFailed with the message "Internal program error: Assertion failed."

test 
 public static void test(boolean mustBeTrue,
                         String explanation) throws AssertionFailed
If the argument is false, throws an AssertionFailed with the given explanation, prefixed by "Internal program error: ".

test 
 public static void test(boolean mustBeTrue,
                         Object explanation0,
                         Object explanation1) throws AssertionFailed
If the argument is false, throws an AssertionFailed with the given explanation arguments, concatenated as strings and prefixed by "Internal program error: ".

Use this routine when you need to avoid paying the overhead of string concatenation ("+") on every test. It does the concatenation only if the test fails.

                         Object explanation0,

Use this routine when you need to avoid paying the overhead of string concatenation ("+") on every test. It does the concatenation only if the test fails.

fail 
 public static void fail() throws AssertionFailed
If this method is executed, it throws an AssertionFailed with the message "Internal program error: 'Unreachable' code was reached." Plant such assertions in places the program should never reach (such as the default case in a switch).
